docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Trying to guard against any transmission of the AIDS virus through sperm banks, the New York State Health Department has drawn up new rules requiring donors to undergo at least two AIDS tests before their sperm is used.

headline.main: New York, in Move to Bar AIDS, Puts New Limits on Sperm Banks

docs.snippet: LEAD: Trying to guard against any transmission of the AIDS virus through sperm banks, the New York State Health Department has drawn up new rules requiring donors to undergo at least two AIDS tests before their sperm is used.

byline.original: By SAM HOWE VERHOVEK, Special to The New York Times

docs.section_name: Front Page; New York and Region

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THE SMELL OF a wood fire on a crisp fall day has a certain allure to a certain set of people, those susceptible to the imagined romance of snuggling indoors near the flames on a chilly night. Since much of my childhood was endured in a house that relied on wood fires for both cooking and heating, the mystique has always mystified me.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ON A BRIGHT MID-SUMMER Wednesday, on the south side of Sunset Boulevard, off La Cienega, Arsenio Hall, the latest prince in the late-night realm where Johnny Carson is king, got a towering present: a billboard with a picture of him sprawled like a diva on a couch, smiling the smile of a Cheshire cat.
